questions.title: Portfolio Mathematics
questions.question:
Assuming no short selling, a diversification benefit is most likely to occur when the correlations among the securities contained in the portfolio are:

  1. greater than +1.
  2. equal to +1.
  3. less than +1.
questions.explanation: Solution Incorrect. Correlation cannot be greater than positive one. Incorrect. If correlations equal 1, no diversification benefit occurs. Correct . As long as security returns are not perfectly positively correlated, diversification benefits are possible. Portfolio Mathematics calculate and interpret the expected value, variance, standard deviation, covariances, and correlations of portfolio returns
questions.solution_html:
Solution

  1. Incorrect. Correlation cannot be greater than positive one.

  2. Incorrect. If correlations equal 1, no diversification benefit occurs.

  3. Correct. As long as security returns are not perfectly positively correlated, diversification benefits are possible.
